intro: Geigeria monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed geigeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and clustered in a single head. Geigeria monocephala is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
